situation.title: Operation of Offices
situation.meta_description: Office hours are limited to 2 days a week for 5 hours.

content.processed:
Rules and recommendations

Office hours are limited to 2 days a week for 5 hours. You can find the opening hours for each Office on the official board of the given office, which is placed by the office building entrance.

Written and/or telephone contact is preferable over a personal visit to the office. This will help reduce the risk of infection to you and those around you.

You can also set up a data-box free of charge for online communication with the authorities. The data-box can be set up at any CzechPoint branch. If you have an e-ID (eObčanka), you can set up a data box online. 

Only necessary matters should be handled in person. If you go to the office in person, it is necessary to have a facemask at all times, disinfect your hands and keep your distance. Keep a distance not only when in the queue but also when communicating with the officials.

It is good to first call the office before the visit to find out if it is necessary for you to go to the office physically, and possibly arrange a specific date of the visit. This will avoid risky waiting in a queue.

Send all documents by mail beforehand.

Increased hygienic measures must be observed by the employees of the office among themselves. More information can be found on this website.

questions_answers.question: Do I have to change my driving license if it expires during the state of emergency?
questions_answers.value:
No. 
The driving license is considered valid for the duration of the state emergency and can only be exchanged after the state emergency.

questions_answers.question: Do I have to change my ID if it expires during the state of emergency?
questions_answers.value:
Yes, all licences other than driving licences are not exempt from the extension of validity (if they expire they have to be renenwed).

How can I communicate with the authorities? For your and the Office's staff safety, give priority to distance communication, meaning that you either send a letter, e-mail, data-box message or call the Office.

If I go to the office in person, do I have to book in advance? No, but it's better to avoid unnecessary waiting in line.

Do I have to have a facemask in the office? Yes.

Where can I find the Office opening hours? Offices can only be opened 2 days a week for 5 hours. You can find out which specific days either on the municipality's website or on the official board of the given office, which is placed by the office building entrance. But usually, it will be Monday and Wednesday.
